intro: Cryptocarya todayensis, commonly known as the New Zealand mountain pepper, is a member of the Lauraceae family. It is a small to medium-sized evergreen tree or shrub native to New Zealand, typically found in coastal and montane regions. The plant is characterized by its aromatic, leathery leaves and small, clustered flowers that bloom in spring. Its fruit is a dark, fleshy drupe that contains several seeds. Cryptocarya todayensis plays an important ecological role in its native habitat, providing food and shelter for various native wildlife species.
